"label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"print_hide": 0, "options": "

I _________________________________ of {{doc.company_name}}

  1. understand my duties under factory act law 0f 2004 and safety laws (including Codes of Practice and Standards that are applicable to the work being undertaken) and to the circumstances in which the work will be conducted.
  3. hold current certification, qualifications and licenses that are required by legislation required for this work.
  4. have completed the Graceco safety induction.
  5. will cease working, make safe the workplace and contact the safety officer if I become aware of danger to myself or others during the period of the work.
  6. have a current Workers Compensation and Rehabilitation Insurance Policy in place.
  7. agree to comply with all the safety requirements and reasonable directions given by Graceco Limited.
", "fieldname": "_custom_html", "fieldtype": "HTML", "label": "Custom HTML"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"print_hide": 0, "fieldname": "permit_start_date", "label": "Permit Start Date"}, {"print_hide": 0, "fieldname": "permit_completion_date", "label": "Permit Completion Date"}, {"print_hide": 0, "fieldname": "approver", "label": "Approver"}, {"print_hide": 0, "fieldname": "authorized_by", "label": "Authorized by"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"print_hide": 0, "options": "
RULES FOR CONTRACTORS
Through co-operation and by following these basic rules you will help keep a healthy and safe work place.
The following rules apply to you and anyone employed by you (including all sub-contractors) and it is your responsibility to ensure that they are made aware of these requirements and comply with them at all times:

1. MOVEMENT WITHIN THE WORK AREA:
Vehicle and pedestrians movements must be in accordance with local traffic and restricted to those areas agreed with the "Company"

2. COMPETENT PERSONS:
Persons employed by you shall be competent to undertake the work specified and be able to operate any necessary equipment safely and without risk.

3. RISK ASSESSMENTS:
Any of your activities which pose a significant risk to the health and safety of people, property, machines or product must be formally assessed and those most likely to be affected, informed of the risks and safety measures that are to be taken.

4. TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT:
Shall be of good working condition and fit for the intended purpose.

5. PORTABLE ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT:
Shall posses a current test certificate. Voltage requirements should not exceed 100 volts unless protected by a suitable residual current circuit breaker.

6. PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE):
For certain tasks or in specified areas the wearing of suitable PPE shall be strictly enforced.

7. HYGIENE:
Any applicable hygiene rules will be strictly enforced.

8. FIRE:
Notices are displayed throughout the premises, you must be aware of safe fire procedures, what action to take if the fire alarm is sounded or if you discover a fire.

9. ACCIDENTS:
In the event of an accident to yourself or to anyone under your control it must be reported to the safety department as soon as is practical to do so.

10. ALCOHOL and CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES:
The consumption of alcohol within the company’s premises is strictly prohibited, moreover anyone found to be under the influence of alcohol or other controlled substances would face disciplinary actions.

", "fieldname": "_custom_html", "fieldtype": "HTML", "label": "Custom HTML"}]
